turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Thirty minutes to break the code... Two hours for the five mechanicals. The seventh lock...that's out of my hands.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: If out plan works...the FBI will get rid of it for us.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yo!

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: We may have some problems.  How is your schedule?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Three down, four to go --

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: Then don't waste time talking to me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You better heat up that miracle				* you were talking about.  We broke through on Number Six, and the Electromagentic came down like a sledgehammer...

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: * Well have a look at what our friends outside are doing and I'll be right up.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: ...the circuits that cannot be cut... are cut automatically in reponse to a terrorist incident...You ask for miracles, Theo...I give you the FBI...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: When you're hot, you're hot.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: Encourage them to be bolder.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The only thing left for them is the City Grid...  ...They may not do it.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I...have a request.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: Oh?  What idiot put you in charge?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You did.  You murdered by Boss.  Now...  They're looking to me.  Personally I'd pass on the jab.  I don't enjoy being this close to you.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: Go on.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: We have a pregnant woman out there --  -- relax, she's not due for two weeks, but a marble floor isn't doing her back any good.  I'd like permission for her to more to one of the offices where there's a sofa.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: No.  But I'll have a sofa brought out to you.  Good enough?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Good enough.  And unless you like is messy, you'd better start taking us in groups to the bathroom.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: Yes, you're right.  It will be done.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: Mr. Takagi chose his people well, Mrs...?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Gennero.  Miss Gennero.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: After all your posturing, all your speeches...you're nothing but a common thief.

turns.speaker: HANS
turns.text: I'm an exceptional thief, Mrs. McClane. And now that I'm moving up to kidnapping, you should be more polite.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Nice, but one of us is three hours out of sync.  I think it's me.  Is there a place I can wash up?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Sure.  Follow me.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: It's a long story.  You know, I think that Ellis has his eye on you.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: That's okay...  ... I have an eye on his private bathroom.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Well, Cappy Roberts retired out here a couple years ago.  He said I could bunk with him.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh...Where does he live?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Ramona...no, Pomona, that's it.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Pomona!  You'll be in the car the whole time...Look, let's make this easy.  I have a spare bedroom.  It's not huge, but the kids would love to have you at the house.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: They would, huh?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I would too. * They lock eyes for a moment, but it's an intense moment that says a lot about how they still feel about each other.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: ...I've missed you.						*

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Especially my name.  You must miss it every time you write a check.  When did you start calling yourself 'Ms. Gennero'?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: This is a Japanese company, you know? They figure a married woman, she's on the way out the door...

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Sure.  It's unnerving.  I remember this one particular married woman, she went out the door so fast there was practically a jetwash...I mean, talk about your wind chill factor...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Didn't we have this same conversation in July?  Damn it, John, there was an opportunity out here -- I had to take it --

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: No matter what it did to our marriage -- ?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: My job and my title and my salary did nothing to our marriage except change your idea of what it should be.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Oh, here it comes.  One of those 'meaningful relationship conversations.' I never should've let you get those magazine subscriptions --

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You want to know my idea of a marriage? It's a partnership where people help each other over the rough spots -- console each other when there's a down...and when there's an up, well, hell, a little Goddamn applause or an attaboy wouldn't be too bad.  I needed that, John.  I deserved that.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I'll be a few minutes.  Wait here --

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Don't I always?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: John!

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Holly, we have to stop meeting like this.  So that's what it was.  A fucking robbery.  So why nuke the building, Hans?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Excuse me, I'm looking for --

turns.speaker: TAKAGI
turns.text: Holly Gennero?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Yeah.  How'd you know?

turns.speaker: TAKAGI
turns.text: I've spent half my life on airplanes,			* I can recognize someone who just got off one.  I'm Joe Takagi, Mr. McClane.  I have ...something to do with this company.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: So I've heard.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Relax, Ellis.  I'm off duty.

turns.speaker: TAKAGI
turns.text: Can I get you anything?  Food?  Cake? Watered down champagne punch?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: I'm fine.  You throw quite a party.  I didn't know they had Christmas in Japan.

turns.speaker: TAKAGI
turns.text: Hey, we're flexible.  Pearl Harbor didn't work out, we got you with tape decks.

turns.speaker: TAKAGI
turns.text: You wife's made for this business. She know how to drive a hard bargain.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Yeah.  I remember our first date.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: I've seen enough phoney ID's in my time to recognize that the ones they've got cost a fortune.  Add all that up and I don't know what the fuck it means, but these are bad ass preps and they're here to stay.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: I hear you...  Partner.  And LA's finest are on it, so light 'em if you got 'em.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: I'm ahead of you...partner.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Uh, what do I call you?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: 'Roy'.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Got it...'Roy'.  Now listen.  If you think of anything else you think we need to know, don't be shy, okay? In the meantime I want you to find a safe place and hole-up and let us do our job.  Understand?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: They're all yours, Al.  Good luck.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: I'm here, Roy, but I'm, uh, kind of busy.  Let's talk later, okay?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Al, what's wrong?  Did something --  -- Oh, God.  You're coming in!  That's it, isn't it?  Christ, Powell, I told you what you're dealing with here --

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: I said we'll talk later, Roy.  If you're what I think you are you should know when to listen, when to shut up... and when to pray.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Safe and sound, thanks to you. What the fuck was that?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: The plastique I found.  Is the building on fire?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: No, but it's gonna need one hell of a paint job and a shitload of screen doors.  One spotters say you got two with that blast.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Two?  Are you sure?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Hey, I love you.  So do a lot of the guys.  So hang in there, man.  Hang in there.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Thanks...partner.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Yeah, just trying to handle some year old twinkies.  Yucck.  What do they put in these things?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: 'Sugar, enriched flour, partially hydrogenated vegetable oil, polysorbate 60 and yellow dye #5.'

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: You sound like a man with a couple of kids.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Not yet, the wife in working on our first.  You got any kids back on the ranch?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Two.  And I'd sure like to see them swinging on the jungle gym with Al junior.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: It's a date.  You buy the ice cream.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Al?  Al, you there?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: I'm here, cowboy.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Speaking of cows, did you ever hear so much bullshit in your life? Two hours?  That doesn't even make any sense --

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Don't tell me, partner.  I'm just a desk jockey who was on the way home when you rang.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: The way you drove that car, I figured you for the streets.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: In my youth, partner.  In my youth.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Roy?  You still with us?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Yeah.  But all things being equal, I'd rather be in Philadelphia.  By the way, chalk up two more terrorists.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: They boys'll be glad.  We got a pool going on you.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Yeah?  What's the odds?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: You don't want to know.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: They way you drive, I can see why.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: I...I shot a kid.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Eleven years ago.  Oh, it was dark... he was big for his age...damn ray gun he had looked real enough...yeah, I had all the right excuses...but afterwards... I really couldn't draw my gun again.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: I...I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to make a joke of it.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Hey, you couldn't know.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: I still feel like shit.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Then this won't matter.  LAPD's not calling the shots anymore.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Powell?  What's going on?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Ask the FBI.  They've got the terrorist playbook and they're running it, step by step.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Look...I'm getting a bad feeling up here...I'd like you to do something for me.  Look up my wife...don't ask how, you'll know by then...and tell her...tell her...I've been a jerk. When things panned out for her, I should've been behind her all the way ...We had something great going until I screwed it up...She was the best thing that ever happened to a bum like me.  She's heard me say I love you a thousand times, but she never got to hear this...honey...I'm sorry.  You get all that?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: I got it.  But you can tell her yourself.  Just watch your ass and you'll make it.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: I hope so.  But that's up to the guy upstairs.  Upstairs...  ...Hans, you bastard...what were you doing?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Roy?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Stand by, Powell.  I gotta check something out.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Al.  Man, you were my rock.  I couldn't have made it without you.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: I'm serious.  Hey, this is my wife... Holly Gennero.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: I am, Sir...Sergeant Al Powell.

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: Dwayne Robinson.  Well, what have you learned?  What do they want?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: The terrorists?  Don't know, Sir. We haven't heard a peep from them.

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: Then who the hell have you been talking too?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: We don't exactly know, Sir.  He won't give us him name.  He appears to be the man who called in the report...he's killed one of the terrorists for sure and claims he capped two others.

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: He claims?  Powell, has it occured to you he could be one of the terrorists, pulling your chain? Or some kind of nut case who --

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: I don't think so, Sir.  In fact... I think he's a cop.  Maybe not LAPD, but definitely a badge.

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: A hunch.  Things he said.  Like, knowing how to recognize a phony ID --

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: -- recognizing phony ID's?  Christ, Powell, he could be a fucking bartender for all we know!

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: What's it look like?  We're going in.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Going in...are you out of your mind? There's 30 hostages in there -- for all we know --

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: -- all we know?  We don't know shit, Powell.  If there's hostages why hasn't anyone asked for ransom?  If there's terrorists, where's their goddamn list of demands?  All we know is that someone shot up your car, and it could be the same flake you've been talking to on the radio!

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: What about the body that fell out of the window -- ?

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: Who the hell knows?  Maybe he was a stockbroker who looked at the Dow Jones and opted for early retirement!

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: Is that him?

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Yessir.

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: Give me that.  Now, listen to me, mister, I don't know what you think you're doing, but demolishing a building doesn't fall under the definition of 'help'! There's hundreds of people out here and you covered half of them in pieces of glass --

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: Goddamn, didn't you hear him!  He practically pulled the Goddamned trigger himself -- he gave that man to them --

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: Christ, can't you read between the lines!  He did everything he could to save him...if he gave himself up they'd both be dead!

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: Maybe.  And maybe they'd at least be talking to us!  Now tell your 'partner' to stay out of it, or so help me if he lives through this I'll put him behind bars myself!

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: He's alone, tired, hunted, and hasn't seen diddly-squat from us and you think he gives a flying fuck about what you're going to do to him? Robinson, wake up and smell the shit you're shoveling!

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: Anytime you want to go home, Sergeant...consider yourself dismissed.

turns.speaker: POWELL
turns.text: This is --

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: This is Deputy Chief Robinson.  Who is this?

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: Gene -- you smilin'?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: No.  I never smile any more.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: Whattaya think: we gonna kill any civilians tonight, Gene?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: I never make bets or guesses, that way I'm never wrong and I never have to pay out.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: Gene, Jesus, what a bull he is!

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: So whatsa deal?

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: They jet's comin' out.  But don't let 'em off the ground.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: What if we gotta kill a whole lot of people?

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: Don't let 'em off the ground.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Listen.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: If you're right I'm gonna back you a hundred percent, you know that.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Fuck you, sir - if I'm right, I don't need you.  What I want is - if I make an honest mistake I want help.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: These seats come out?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Jesus, you're the man!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Come on, what's under this?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I was lookin' at it.  I saw you, man!  Jesus!  You oughta see yourself!  You wouldn't believe it.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yes, I would.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: God damn it, Sheila isn't gonna believe it.  They just call in and say gas up a stretchout and get it down to  and I say, 'shit, another load of Elks for the massage parlors.'

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Aw, hey...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Come on, nobody's gonna get hurt. If they were gonna shoot, they'd shoot now.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You'll be okay.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: You men shoot, aim for the white meat!

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Hey, Sonny!  I'm watchin' it on TV!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What about the kids?

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: They don't know, I sent them to the neighbors.  Sonny, Jesus, it's not like you.  I can't believe, because you never hurt anybody since the day I knew you.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Heidi, I'm dying.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: I blame myself, Sonny.  I notice you been tense, like something is happening; the night before last you're yellin' at the kids like a madman, believe me.  And then you wanted me to go on this ride with the kids, this caterpillar about from here to there - fulla one- year-old kids.  It's ridiculous. I'm not about to go on this ride, so you yell right there, 'You pig, get on the fuckin' ride!' Well, everything fell outta - me - my heart, my liver fell to the floor - you name it!  Yellin' at me in front of all those people.  Because you never talked and I never been scared of you, never.  I think: he's gonna shoot me and dump my body in the river.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Heidi, for Christ sake, shut up! Will you shut your fucking mouth and listen?!

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: See?  You're screaming with the language and all!  A person can't communicate with you.  You become a stranger in your own home...

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: ...because you hurt me, God how you hurt me.  Can you imagine, marrying another man?  Did I do something to make you do that?  Did I ever turn you down, or anything?  The only thing I couldn't do, you're gonna laugh, is go on top - I got this fear of high places!  And I let myself get fat.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Don't call yourself fat.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: I know you can't stand me to say I'm fat.  Like I can't stand you being a bank robber.  I guess that's what love is -- huh, Sonny?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Heidi - why didn't you come down here?

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Jesus - what - I'm afraid - I'm gonna get shot or whatever.  You oughta see it on TV, the guns, the cops, they got cannon, machine guns, they're loaded with gear.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: They're not after you, they're after me.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Listen, it's late already when I realize it's not just a couple of ordinary faggots, it's just you and Sal.  I couldn't get a baby sitter.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Sonny, I'm gettin' real bad vibes.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Jackie - what are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Maybe we can take something smaller... like a Spanish grocery.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: It's too late - just get away from me - don't talk to me now - go over to your place...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hey, don't take the car!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, how'll I get home?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Take the subway.  We need the car.  Hey, gimme the keys - the keys!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Sonny, there's somebody under that desk over there... I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: It's okay... it's okay...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Jenny?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: He says he doesn't know.  Why don't you cook whatever's there?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: It looks like a whole roast.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Honey, send out for Kentucky fried chicken.  The baby, just open a bottle of prunes, and one of the beef.  The bottles are in the fridge.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What guns?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: The robbers in the bank.  They got guns?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Yeah.  A lot of guns.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Well, stay away from them.  Don't get close.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Oh, yeah, I will...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'll kiss the baby for you.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: JESUS FREAK
turns.text: Jesus Christ is coming back and he's really pissed.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah, well I don't blame him.

turns.speaker: JESUS FREAK
turns.text: You know, Sonny, I used to dope a lot, and I was into dipping?  And I did a couple bank jobs, and the Lord Jesus in his everlasting mercy saved me, you know how?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: No.  Look, we're kind of....

turns.speaker: JESUS FREAK
turns.text: That's why I can talk to you, as an equal, Sonny.  You got to merge your whole soul with God.  And then you are Him and one with the Holy Ghost.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah, well...maybe you better talk to one of these others, okay?

turns.speaker: JESUS FREAK
turns.text: Sonny?  Don't send me away!  I can help you save your soul ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hello.  Hello, Leon.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Hello, Sonny.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: How are you doing?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Well... I'm out of the hospital.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah.  You said... I thought you were never getting out?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I never thought I'd get out this way.  I'll tell you.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Well.... huh ...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Ooohh....

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Oh... huh ... how you feeling?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I'm really shakey.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Well, you know ... Moretti told me before that you were drugged up.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah.  It was terrible.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: That... huh... they just shoot you with drugs.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You come in and they say, right away, that you are crazy.  And they start putting things in your arm... you know.  How do they expect you to get uncrazy if you're asleep all the time?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You can't talk or do anything.  You really feel... you know... I'm just sort of coming out of it now.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: So... that sure is something.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah.  So how are you?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Fine, thank you.  I'm in trouble. That is... now I am!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah... I know.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I don't know what I'm gonna do... you know.  Boy... I'm dying.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What?  What are you talking about? You are dying?  Did you ever listen to yourself when you say that?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What do you mean... what am I talking about?  Do you realize that you say that to me every day of your life?  I am dying.  Do you know... do you realize the death that you are spreading around to the people who are around you?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Now don't give me that deep shit now.  Don't start with that shit.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No really... I don't think that you realize what it means.  The things that you do, Sonny.  You put a gun to somebody's head...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I don't know what I'm doing.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah... obviously you don't... when you put a gun to somebody's head... and you say go to sleep so that it won't hurt when I pull the trigger. Death?  Don't talk about death to me.  I have been living with death for the last six months.  Why do you think I'm in the hospital?  I take a handful of pills to get away from you.  And then here I am out of the hospital talking to you on the phone... again.  I have no friends left.  No job.  I can't live.  I have to live with people. This death business... I'm sorry!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I'm not on the phone to talk to you about that.  Well, I don't know what to say, Leon.  When you gimme that... when you hit me with that shit.  I mean, what am I supposed to say?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I told you.  That I got a lot of pressures.  You said to me that you needed money, and I knew that you needed money!  I saw you there lying in the hospital like that... and I said... shit, man, I got to get this guy some money.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: But I didn't ask you to go rob a bank.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: All right.  I know you didn't ask me.  You didn't ask me but I did it.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I did it on my own.  I did this all on my own.  I ain't laying it on anybody.  Nothing on anybody.  I'll tell you something, though, it's about time that I squared away my accounts... you know.  I am squaring away my accounts with life.  Maye this whole thing is gonna end, somehow.  Maybe it'll just end! Maybe I'll just close my eyes and the whole fucken thing will be over. That would be all right too!  I said... I thought I would square it away with you... you know?  That I would get you down here and that I would say so long to you... or, if you wanted... you know, to take a trip...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What trip?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I'm getting out of here, man.  I'm not going to stay here and I'm not giving up.  I mean, huh, they're going to kill me, anyway.  So fuck it!  But, if I can get out of this... I am going to get out. And, how I'm going to do it is to get a jet out of here and I'm flying the fuck out... That's all, Leon.  If you want to come with me, then you're entitled... you can come.  You're free to do what you want.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I'm free to do what I want?  And you think I would want to go with you some place on a plane?  Where? Where ya going?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I gotta jet coming here and we're gonna try to get the fuck outta this thing.  And we're gonna go, man!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You're really crazy.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I know!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Where you gonna go?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Who the fuck knows?  I think we're gonna go ... we worked it out to Algeria.  So, I don't know.  So I'll go to Algeria.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Why you going to Algeria?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Huh ... I don't know.  They got Howard Johnson's there.  I don't know why the fuck I'm going there for.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Howard Johnson's... you're warped. You know that?  You're really warped!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I know that.  I'm warped... I'm warped!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: God, Algeria!  Do you know there's a bunch of... they walk around there... God!  People walk around with masks and things on their heads.  They're a bunch of crazy people there.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I don't know... you could have picked a better place.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Denmark?  Sweden?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I like that... yeah!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Sal wanted to go to Wyoming.  I told him it wasn't a country.  We gotta get outta the country!  To hell with a guy who doesn't know where Wyoming is.  Okay.  Can you imagine what kind of a shape I'm in?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: So!  Sal is with you?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Sal?  Yeah... Sal is with me.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Oh... wow!  Sonny, you're really into one mess now.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I know I am.  I know!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Sal... Sal... Naturale, oh boy!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: He ain't going out.  And if I go out he's just gonna kill the people. There's a lot of lives that I'm responsible for... that's all.  So, I can't do anything.  I got myself into this mess and I'll get myself out of it... the best way I know how!  One of the ways is not giving up.  I'm telling ya!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Would you do something for me? Please?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: These guys that got me down here, you know, huh... they think that I'm part of this whole thing.  They think I'm part of the plot to rob the bank!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: How did they think that?  What are they... crazy?  What do you mean. That's bullshit, Leon.  They're giving you a fucken story.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Well... they told me that I was an accomplice...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Oh... they're fucken crazy.  That's a snow job.  Don't listen to that shit!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I gotta listen to it if they think...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Shit...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I can't survive in prison, Sonny...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: All right.  Then what do you want me to say?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Sonny, would you please just tell them... please...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Where are they now?  Just tell me... are they on the phone now?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: That's great.  Just terrific.  You talk to me with them on the phone, right?  That is really smart.  And, you don't tell me?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I don't have a choice.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You don't have a choice?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No!  They're standing all around me. Seven thousand fucken cops... all around me.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Look... who's on the phone?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Look... don't throw that on me.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Who's on the phone, now?  What do you mean... throw it on you?  You knew it, right?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah... I knew it.  But, what choice do I have?  I'm in the hospital; they drag me out of the hospital... bring me down here...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: All right, enough!  Who the fuck is on the phone... anyway?  Is that you Moretti?  You on the phone?  Will somebody talk to me?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: They won't talk to you.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Are they on the phone still?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah... yeah!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: All right!  He didn't do it.  All right?  Now... would you get the fuck off the phone?  I'll bet that really changed them, huh?  Anyway, Leon... did I do it for you?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah... huh, thank you.  I'm going to go back, Sonny, to the hospital. They're really nice people.  They're really trying to help me.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: That's good then.  You've found something.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Well... I don't know if I have or not.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Do you still want the operation?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah... yeah.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Well, then...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: It's my only chance!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I don't know what to say to ya!  I guess I just wanted to say I'll see ya... or whatever.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Thank you much... and huh, bon voyage.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Right.  See you sometime.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah... see ya in my dreams, huh?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah... I'll write a song.  Ha, ha. I don't know.  Life is funny!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You said a mouthful... sweetheart!

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Leon?  Whatsa matter?  They give you a shot down the hospital or what?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Oh, God, they shot me with like unreal!

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Well, you got to get hold of yourself.  You got to talk to him, tell him to give himself up.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Oh no!

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: He's got eight people in there with him.  He's got this kid with him ... they're gonna shoot the people.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I can't help it.  I can't stop him from anything.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: If he won't listen to you, who will he listen to?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: He won't listen to anybody.  He's been very crazy all summer.  Since June he's been trying to kill me.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: You try calling the police?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What good is that?  They couldn't stop him.  And it'd just make him mad.  They don't know him.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Somebody's got to stop him, Leon.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: He was under great strain: you don't understand, he's a very mixed up person.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: He's makin' threats in there.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: He's scared.  It's crazy.  I never met anyone like him.  His wife, he's a wonderful father to his children.  His mother - you should see her - his mother and father together are like a bad car wreck - he lets it all slide off his back, he sees them, he pays their rent. Unbelievable.  I wanted to get married ... He didn't really want it ... he's married already!  But he did it.  I don't know why.  I thought it would help me, but it didn't.  I was just as confused and unhappy was before; I did terrible things.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: What kind of things, Leon?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Ten days I spent in Atlantic City - Sonny was frantic - he knew I was drinking; he didn't know where I was ... who I was with.  I couldn't explain why I did the things I did. So I went to this psychiatrist who explained to me I was a woman in a man's body.  So Sonny right away wanted to get me money for a sex change operation: but where was he to get that?  2500 dollars!  My God, he's in hock up to his ears already.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: He needed money?  For the operation for you?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: It made him crazy - so much demand, he'd fly into this rages.  And I got more depressed than ever; I saw I'd never get the operation.  So I tried to take my life - I swallowed about a half pound of pills ... blues, reds, yellows, downers, uppers, screamers ... you name it. But I just threw them up and wound up in the hospital.  Sonny comes there and looks at me and just says: 'Wow!'  So when I hear he's in the bank, I almost go crazy because I know he's doin' it for me.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Well, don't you figure you owe to him to get him out of there?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I can't talk to him.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: You're in it up to your ass, Leon. You're an accessory.  You talk him out of there and they might be a little more understanding of your case.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: How is he gonna hurt you on the telephone?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I don't know what to say to him.  I can't.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: You think it over, Leon.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: What are you doin' in there?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: This is Detective Sergeant Moretti, asshole, we got you completely by the balls.  You don't believe me, I'm lookin' you right in the eye. Right now, I can see you...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What a fuckin' comedy!  WNEW plays all the hits.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Listen, first off, is anybody hurt in there?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: ... But you keep away from the bank or we start throwing bodies out the front door one at a time... You got it?  Okay?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Okay, you're in there and we're out here.  What do we do now?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I told you -- keep away.  I don't know what we do now.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Awright, but I wanna talk to you. First off, we wanna know if the people in the bank are okay.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: They're okay.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: You alone, or you got confederates?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I'm not alone.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: How many you got in there?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I got Sal.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Sal?  What's that for?  Salvatore?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Sal.  He's the killer.  We're Vietnam veterans so killing don't mean anything to us, you understand?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Right -- got ya.  Okay, so there's you -- what's your name?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What do you want to know that for?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Give me a name, any name, just so I got somethin' to call you.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Call me Sonny-boy.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Sonny-boy, one word?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: One word.  You won't find it in the phone book.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Listen, Sonny ... can I call you Sonny for short?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Call me whatever you want.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Okay, Sonny, I want to see if the people in the bank are okay, then what I want to do is work out a way to get them out of there.  I want to come over there, without a gun ... and you can frisk me.  So you can see you can trust me.  So we can talk and find a way outta this mess.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I frisk you?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: You frisk me.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Right -- I'm with you, buddy.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: I'd like just some sign I can trust you too, Sonny.  I don't want to trust my body out where you could just shoot me.  Some sight ... right?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Sure ... like ... I'm not gonna shoot you.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: How about letting the people out of the bank.  Why put them in this position?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: They're what's keeping me alive. You think you're dealing with an idiot?  Talk to me then.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Okay, give us the women.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Oh, no ... Women is all we got.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: You're all one way!  I'm bein' reasonable with you; give me somethin' ... Give me one of them, anyway ... Just one ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: So -- you want me to send one out there ... Okay.  I'll see what I can do.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You got these cops outta here. They're comin' in too close.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Come on.  I want you to see something.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You want me to give up, huh?  Look, Sal's in back with the girls. Anything happens to me - one move - and Sal gives it to them.  Boom boom.  How do I know you won't jump me?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: I don't forget about Sal and the boom boom room.  I want you to see this.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Let Sal come out, take a look. What hope you got?  Quit while you're ahead.  All you got is attempted robbery.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: ... armed robbery ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Well, armed, then.  Nobody's been hurt.  Release the hostages, nobody is gonna worry over kidnapping charges, the worst you're gonna get is five years -- you can be out in a year.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: When I'm bein' fucked, I like to be kissed a lot.  Who the fuck are you tryin' to con me into some deal?  You're a city cop, where's the FBI?  This is a federal offense, I got kidnapping, armed robbery, they're gonna bury me!  You know it, you can't talk for them, you're some flunky pig tryin' to bullshit me.  Now God damn it, get somebody in charge here to talk to me!

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Calm down, you're not ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Calm down... look at this, look at him...!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: He wanted to kill me!

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: It's okay, you got a lot of protection.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I want a helicopter to get outa here!  And a jet to take us to...  ... wherever we want to go.  Outa the country, so no little jets.  A big one with a bar and a piano lounge.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: I don't know, Sonny.  I don't know if the helicopters can land in here. I'll have to check it out.  I got superiors, unnerstan?  They don't always see eye to eye with me. I'll do what I can.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Sonny, be reasonable!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I want to see my wife.  I want you to bring her down here.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Okay, what do you give me?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: The girl hostages.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Nothin' doin'.  I give you one hostage when you bring my wife, and one for the helicopter, one for the jet, and the rest can come home on the jet.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: I'll see what they'll do.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What the hell you doin' back there?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Sonny, come on out!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What the fuck do you want?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: They were ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You tryin' to fuck me?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: No, I'm not tryin' to fuck you.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: So, what were they doin'?  You're tellin' me you had nothin' to do with that back there?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: I swear to God I had nothing to do with it ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Bullshit ... I don't walk to talk to you ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Wait a minute ... everything you asked for is on the way ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Is on its way ... The helicopter can't land but we got a bus ... the jet's on its way to Kennedy ... we got a bus coming here ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You're full of shit ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Sonny, your wife's on the way ... We reached her ... your wife's on the way ... everything you asked for, you got.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Well, what were you doin' back there?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: It can't happen again ... I'll do everything I can to stop anything I can ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You know, you're telling me that a helicopter can't land here ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Can't land ... you'd kill people ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Don't fuck with me ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: I'm not ... I'm not ... you're gettin' a bus ... you're gettin' a bus ... the jet's comin' into Kennedy ... and your wife's on the way ... what else do you need? What else can I get you?  Listen, I don't know how you can do better ... see that man over there ... the FBI guy ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Just one more explosion like that and you're gonna see a dead body ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: There won't be ... there won't be ... What else do you need?  How else can we help you?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: All right ... I got some hungry people in there ... I want to get some pizza ... some stuff like that ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: What else?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Cokes, seven-ups ...  also some aspirin ...

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Aspirins ... okay you got it.  Charlie!  Six pizzas!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: We're bringing in your wife...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Is he all right?  Is he all right?

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: He's all doped up.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I want to talk to him.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: He's groggy, Sonny.  Let me get him on his feet and he'll call you back.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: Here comes the FBI.  You men lookin' for protection?  We got all the police right here.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: Why didn't you just wait and try to take 'em out there in the street?

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: We're all set at Kennedy.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: What makes you think you'll be able to control it?

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: He's totally unstable.  He'll make a mistake.

turns.speaker: MORETTI
turns.text: He hasn't so far.  I'm the one who can make a mistake.  That's what scares the shit out of me.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: Eugene, at 3:07, this became Federal.  Why don't I take it over now?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Okay, okay... we know it's a stickup!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: If he moves - blow his guts out... Cover him!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hey... let him out!

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Do what the gentleman says, Howard.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay, is the vault open?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I can take care of that.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I must of been outta my mind.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Well, you get your mind right.  I'm a Catholic and I don't wanna hurt nobody, but goddamn it, don't you play no games with me.  Unnastand?!?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Come on, lemme load you up...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: This is it?  What am I gonna do with this?  Holy shit!

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: It's all we got.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay, don't worry about it.  Stick it in the bag...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hey, you, manager... Don't get any ideas, fucker... See that man there? I bark and he bites!

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Believe me, I'm on your side.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: My side, shit!

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Hello... I'm sorry I can't talk to you right now... I suggest you call during banking hours tomorrow. What is your name?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Gimme the traveler's checks and the register.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Howard, give him the keys...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Gimme the keys to get outta here!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: The gun's right on your back...

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Give me the keys...

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: For God's sake, will you please go now?  We gave you every nickel we got.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You're goin' outside with me.  If there's no cops around, we just split.  Otherwise, you go with us.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Hello, Mulvaney here...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Sal, get 'em in the vault.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I swear to God... on my salary, I'm not gonna be any hero...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I took too long.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Where's the back door?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: It's locked on the inside.  It's through that passageway and to the right.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Now, you -- what's your name?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Mulvaney...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You and me are checking the other ways in and out.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Let's go to the back door.  How'd that guy get to be a guard?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Well, they go to guard school.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: To what ... learn how to shoot? They don't get a gun.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: They make $105 a week to start. They fold the flag, check the place out in the morning.  I don't know what they learn, Sonny.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You got kids?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I got two kids ... and I'd like to see them again.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Ah, I know!  You're being very cooperative.  I got no complaint against you whatever; you got bank insurance?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Don't ask me questions.  I got connections.  You find out who I am, you're cold meat.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I don't care who you are ...  I just want to get you outta here, safe, right?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What if I take you with me?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: If you take anybody, please take me.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: They'll shoot you; the fucking cops'll shoot you ... they don't give a damn.  In spite of that bank insurance.  You see what they did in Attica, they shot everybody, the hostages, prisoners, cops, guards, forty-two people they killed, the innocent with the guilty.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You're just a nice guy, Mr. Mulvaney. Only don't fuck around with me, you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I don't fool around with you.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: The TV ... they want to talk to you ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Why the hell did he do that?  What the hell did I do?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I guess he didn't appreciate your use of language.  They don't speak that way on television.  It's a rule.  Do you realize you've cut off a valuable source of communication?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You see what we're dealing with? They want me to kill all of you!

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: What now, Sonny?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Wait a minute ... I've been looking at this all wrong ... Let's look at it the other way ...
